Articles.Content: I have installed the "After Kerbin" mod and I wish to remove it I was able to delete everything in it except "sigma" I tried deleting it multiple times and it's still has all the planets from the mod
Did you delete the entire After Kerbin mod from the GameData folder?

13 hours ago, ReidUzumaki said:

I have installed the "After Kerbin" mod and I wish to remove it I was able to delete everything in it except "sigma" I tried deleting it multiple times and it's still has all the planets from the mod

Per the After Kerbin install instructions, there are several dependency mods which are also installed, seperately.

  

1 - Download After Kerbin (Hopefully you've done that, since you're reading this!)

2 - Download and install Kopernicus - https://github.com/Kopernicus/Kopernicus/releases/download/release-1.7.3-2/Kopernicus-1.7.3-2.zip

3 - Download and install CTTP - https://github.com/Galileo88/Community-Terrain-Texture-Pack/releases/download/1.0.4/CTTP.v1.0.4.zip

4 - Download and install Scatterer - https://github.com/LGhassen/Scatterer/releases/download/0.052/Scatterer0.052.zip

5 - Download and install EVE - https://github.com/WazWaz/EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements/releases/download/EVE-1.4.2-2/EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements-1.4.2.2.zip

6 - Download and install Sigma Replacements - Skybox - https://github.com/Sigma88/Sigma-Replacements/releases/download/B_v0.4.0/Sigma-Replacements_SkyBox.v0.4.0.zip

To install After Kerbin, simply drag the After Kerbin folder to your GameData folder.
Any issues? Contact me on discord Gameslinx#0544, or the After Kerbin forum post.

I imagine you still have #6 installed.
If you dont have *any* other Sigma mods you are using, but *only* Sigma Replacements - Skybox, you can delete the /Sigma folder which should solve your issue. If you *do* have other Sigma mods installed that you want to keep, *and* nothing else that changes the skybox, delete the /Sigma/Replacements/Skybox folder *only*

14 hours ago, ReidUzumaki said:

I have installed the "After Kerbin" mod and I wish to remove it I was able to delete everything in it except "sigma" I tried deleting it multiple times and it's still has all the planets from the mod

1 hour ago, Stone Blue said:

I imagine you still have #6 installed.

Not sure SigmaReplacements would cause "it's still has all the planets from the mod", I would suggest a clean install (delete everything from GameData except for "Squad" and "SquadExpansion") then re-install only the mods you actually want to use

OOpss... My reading comprehension must have been off this AM .. (still hadnt finished my morning cofeve )...
The part that it was *planets* that were still showing, must not have sunk in... I just read the "Sigma" part... lol

Edited December 9, 2019 by Stone Blue

On 12/8/2019 at 10:21 PM, Nookis said:

Did you delete the entire After Kerbin mod from the GameData folder?

Yes I did "sigma" is the only thing that keeps coming back

On 12/9/2019 at 10:08 AM, Sigma88 said:

Not sure SigmaReplacements would cause "it's still has all the planets from the mod", I would suggest a clean install (delete everything from GameData except for "Squad" and "SquadExpansion") then re-install only the mods you actually want to use

 

 

I just removed sigma and relaunched the game it still is there i'm doing something wrong
Do you manage your mods manually?  There is no way that I am aware of for any mods to re-install themselves.  So I don't know what you might be doing wrong.

I can't help you more unless you share at least the logs and possibly even the mm cachefile

The logs are found in: %AppData%/../LocalLow/Squad/KerbalSpaceProgram/Player.log

(Going by memory so it might be wrong)

 

And the mm cachefile is found in GameData
